features: Compact yet powerful: Strong enough performance for home, with a sleek, compact design for travel.
Efficient and durable: 1000-watt iron with microsteam durable stainless-steel soleplate.
Versatile design: Irons with or without steam and works with tap water, no need for distilled water
Easy to use: Large transparent water tank
Compact design: Sleek handle folds for travel storage, travel pouch included
Flexible usage: Dual-voltage system works on 120V or 230V
Small details: Precision tip smoothes collars, seams and narrow edges
body.description: The DA1560 is a compact iron with all the benefits of a full sized Rowenta. Powerful steam is generated at a constant rate for optimal efficiency with a burst of steam button to remove tough wrinkles. The microsteam stainless steel soleplate has a precision tip for reaching narrow edges, seams and collars. The compact iron has a full range thermostat for use on all fabric types, and vertical steam capability to remove wrinkles in hanging garments. A transparent tank holds over 2-ounce of regular tap water, and the handle folds flat for storage. Ideal for travel, a dual voltage switch ensures that the iron is powerful at 120 or 230-volt. Travel pouch included.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Founded in Germany in 1909, Rowenta has a long history of innovation. In 1912, Rowenta manufactured their first iron, paving the way for their position today as the world’s largest producer of irons. In 1949, Rowenta launched the first iron with a temperature control and thermostat, followed by the first steam iron in 1957. In 1974, Rowenta expanded into floor care and launched their first vacuum cleaner in Europe. Rowenta manufactures the best, most technologically advanced German-engineered irons, and today is bringing its latest floor and home care innovations to North America with the same attention to high quality. DA1560 TRAVEL Compact Steam Iron First Class Compact steam iron for a worry-free travel ! The DA1560 TRAVEL compact steam iron is a fully-featured, high performance, quality steam iron which performs all traditional ironing tasks. The sleek ergonomic design provides comfort while ironing and the Microsteam stainless steel soleplate offers superior glide and a precision tip for faster easier ironing. True dual voltage makes the iron ideal for travel and the handle folds flat for compact storage. First Class iron also offers burst of steam as well as vertical and variable steam, on/off steam control enabling ironing with our without steam and a full range thermostat. 1000-watt iron with microsteam stainless-steel soleplate Adjustable temperature; consistent steam; burst-of-steam button Vertical-steam option Compact size; handle folds flat for storage; Travel pouch included 2-ounce transparent water tank Dual-voltage switch: 120 - 240 Volts

Features Unique Microsteam Stainless Steel Soleplate Standing apart from the rest, the highly polished Microsteam 200 stainless steel soleplate not only glides perfectly across all fabrics; it also offers superior steam distribution thanks to its 200 steam holes. Its high-precision tip works well for getting into pleats, between buttons, and along seams. Folding handle Handle folds flat for storage or traveling. Dual Voltage The two heating elements ensure the iron is as powerful at 120 volts as it is at 240 volts and provides the full range of ironing temperatures. Travel pouch included Drawstring cloth bag for easy storage or travel.

ROWENTA DA1560 Travel Compact Steam Iron ROWENTA DW2070 Effective Steam Iron ROWENTA DW5080 Focus Steam Iron ROWENTA DW8080 Promaster Steam Iron ROWENTA DW5197 Focus Steam Iron ROWENTA DW6080 Eco Steam Iron Microsteam soleplate 200 holes 300 holes 400 holes 400 holes 400 holes 400 holes Stainless steal soleplate ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ Watts 1000 W 1600 W 1700 W 1700 W 1725 W 1700 W Vertical/Variable steam ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ Self Clean ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ Anti-calc system ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ Anti-drip ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ Auto off ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ Energy savings 25 % energy savings Burst of steam 100g/min 100g/min 150g/min 180g/min 180g/min

ZD100 Soleplate cleaning kit The Rowenta ZD100 soleplate cleaning kit contains a specially formulated cream that cleans soleplates by removing the draggy coating caused by excess starch, detergent build up and burned on synthetics. It is also ideal at removing melted webs, fusible, iron on interfacings and trims. The cleaning kit is appropriate on all types of soleplates. Kit contains: 1-ounce tube of soleplate cleaner; application cloth; polishing / finishing cloth and set of instructions.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great travel iron!
reviews.reviewText: It works great, gets really hot, produces plenty of steam. Great quality and compact. I’m glad we purchased this iron. It will save us a lot of money sending cloths out to press when we travel on cruise ships.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Exceeds my expectations! Light weight and sturdy; I don't foresee any handle breakage; it is locked in and should not require any hard hand pressure for wrinkle release, just guidance. I initially bought this after my previous "mini" steam iron was recalled and failed after one year; leaking all over my work table. This Rowenta "travel iron" has been used a lot for quilting and clothes making. It is light and maneuverable enough for my granddaughter to learn on with guidance vs. my normal sized Rowenta. I have not traveled with it... It does require filling frequently due to it's tank size, but that is to be expected.Description says that tap water may be used -- I would like to state for the record that tap water of any kind is NEVER used in any iron that I have owned. I have only used DISTILLED bottled water and I do not empty it out after each use. Tap water will contain minerals and/or chemicals for purification and will increase the risk of white mineral build up from the steam holes and internal damage to an iron. I have never had any leakage in any of the 4 irons I have owned in my life time -- except for the recalled one that was defective (My first one in 1972 is still going strong, but a little too heavy for me now). In my opinion, the small price of distilled water outweighs the risk of iron damage.My absolute favorite quality of this product (unlike the non-compact version), is that it does NOT have auto-shut off after a few moments of non use. You must unplug it to turn off. In my experience with the Rowenta Focus Excel Iron, Standard, when in the middle of piecing quilt parts and sewing clothing, it is extremely annoying for the iron to shut off while I am sewing and ironging multiple pieces in succesion and have the iron shut off -- having to wait for it to "wake up" befpre proceeding to the next step. While this safety shut-off feature may be prevelant in today's retail setting, I as the user must bear some responsibility and unplug it after use. Thank you Rowenta for having this no shut-off option on this iron.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I was looking for a small iron for my quilting sewing table and this was the perfect size. I find it works perfectly for my needs. It heats up FAST, has LOTS of steam and gets into all the small spaces I need it to. TIP: Use tap water or it WON'T steam. I've got a big daddy Rowenta that I love and this one is just as good!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars It’s good for small work but still not ‘it’
reviews.reviewText: I’m a textile artist and quilter and I bought this because I needed something compact to take to workshops. It’s a great little iron for doing small work. I love that it stays hot, doesn’t switch off when you aren’t using it. But the steam feature isn’t great. Either too much, or not enough. And it doesn’t get very hot. But, so cute and tiny and easy to store and transport.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2012
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Precision German Engineering in a Light and Versatile Form
reviews.reviewText: My wife and I are a retired couple. We travel frequently cross country in our RV to spend time with our children and grand children. We have had Rowenta full size irons for decades and we have been quite happy with their performance, but they are quite heavy for quick and light duties. So my wife decided to buy a light domestic copy. One after another, they proved unreliable and total waste of money.Then we came across this light, travel-size Rowenta and we immediately bought it from Amazon. It was money well spent. The quality is typical Rowenta; German engineering and all. It is so light even my 96 year-old mother could lift it and use it quite easily (provided she does not mistakenly put it in the kitchen sink.) No pun intended big Mama!The sole-plate is highly polished stainless steel which makes it a smooth gliding machine on all types of fabric. Lo and Behold we can also take it with us to London, England since it has a built-in current inverter which allows it to operate on either 120v or 240V for European or continental travel.It has this ingenious design which makes the handle serve as water tank as well. The handle can be locked up for use or locked down for storage. And surprisingly for such a teeny weeny iron, it is rated 1000 watt, which makes it ideal for very quick, last-minute-type emergency use.It has a very powerful steam engine for its size rendering it quite effective on wrinkled woolens and heavily wrinkled cotton fabrics, albeit, my wife says she would not use it on linens due to its small footprint and light weight. For that, she has the full size Rowenta anyway.The soul plate is so highly polished and so smooth that it will hardly ever need cleaning since we do not believe any residual gunk could stick to it. I would not recommend that you leave it flat down unattended on any fabric though; it is after all a 1kw iron, light weight not withstanding.All in all, I am happy with the purchase since my wife is so happy with the iron, and we have given it a 4-star rating. We would have given it 5-star had it had a more robust, non-plastic handle with a heavier duty locking mechanism. The current handle is the only weak point in the package. The German engineers sneeze-goofed only on this part ...Gesundheit!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect! Well Worth the Higher Price
reviews.reviewText: A little pricier than some travel irons, but well worth it. This little iron delivers a lot of steam and works as well as my large Rowenta for travel and sewing. Designed specifically to handle tap water, it can be used just about anywhere. Long cord and zipper carrying bag. Small enough to easily tuck into a suitcase. It may weigh more than some travel irons that don’t work as well, if that’s a factor for you. Far exceeded my expectations! Couldn’t be more pleased with this purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars 6 months in and my daily driver
reviews.reviewText: Forget the large irons and steamers. This guy does it all for me. Compact, packs in a suitcase, takes tap water, irons and steams. It’s all I need.
Excelente calidad y el tamaño es muy conveniente.

Es veloz para calentar el agua y el vapor es constante siempre, es excelente, no como las vaporeras convencionales y grandes con depósito de agua de marcas como tfal u otras marcas comerciales, para viajes es la opción ideal para quitar rápido las arrugas a la ropa, lo único para lo que una vaporera no funciona es para planchar camisas blancas

reviews.reviewTitle: This is a great little iron that does its job well!
reviews.reviewText: This iron heats up very quickly and works well. It also steams very well. It is my second time purchasing this only because I broke the handle. I love it.
J'adore mon nouveau défroisseur, il est petit, léger et fonctionne à merveille

To start with it didn’t do a great job, the wrinkles would get smaller but not disappear. After 3 uses no more steam coming out. It’s not the first time something from Amazon stopped functioning soon after purchase and it’s impossible to have a refund.
